metadata.title: CVE-2022-41317 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in Squid 4.9 through 4.17 and 5.0.6 through 5.6.Due to inconsistent handling of internal URIs, there can be Exposure ofSensitive Information about clients using the proxy via an HTTPS request toan internal cache manager URL. This is fixed in 5.7.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-41317` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

squid - 5.2-1ubuntu4.2
squid-cgi - 5.2-1ubuntu4.2
squid-common - 5.2-1ubuntu4.2
squid-openssl - 5.2-1ubuntu4.2
squid-purge - 5.2-1ubuntu4.2
squidclient - 5.2-1ubuntu4.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: squid package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.2-1ubuntu4.2').
